result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Deida was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID requirement applies to all vehicles which are registered in your name and any vehicles you operate.  During your IID requirement period, you may not operate any motor vehicle without an IID installed.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael A. Deida in court with attorney Colleen Bradley.  Defendant Michael A. Deida in custody.  Adam J. Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

OWI(5TH OR 6TH); CONDITIONS:   Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances unless prescribed by Physician.  Comply with the 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  No driving until valid.

Defendant Michael A. Deida in court with attorney Colleen Bradley.  Defendant Michael A. Deida in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 09:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
